article_title: Texas' Epic Health Services Buys Option 1
article_text:
Texas' Epic Health Services Buys Option 1

Photo: Courtesy Of Epic Chris Roussos, CEO and president of Epic Health Services, a...

In an effort to "fundamentally improve and coordinate the care" of very sick children, Texas-based Epic Health Services has acquired one of the nation's leading providers of feeding tubes, a company official said in an interview on Friday.

article_metadata.description: In an effort to "fundamentally improve and coordinate the care" of very sick children, Texas-based Epic Health Services has acquired one of the nation's leading providers of feeding tubes, a company official said in an interview on Friday.  Chris Roussos, President and CEO of Epic Health Services which provides skilled pediatric home health care, said the move simply made sense as it brings product and nursing together and help streamline care during trying times for families.  The Dallas-based Epic Health Services, which has four offices in the Houston area, is considered the largest provider of home health care for medically fragile children.
article_metadata.author.name: By Jenny Deam
